question:
Which of the following is / are correct statements?
  1. All of Estonia, Latvia, Finland and Lithuania are Baltic countries
  2. All of Tonga, Tuvalu, Vanuatu and Kiribati are Oceanian countries
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Baltic Sea is located in Northern Europe and is connected by man-made waterways to the White Sea via the White Sea Canal, and to the North Sea via the Kiel Canal. The countries that have a shoreline with Baltic Sea are Denmark, Estonia, Latvia, Finland, Germany, Lithuania, Poland, Russia, and Sweden. These altogether make Baltic Region. Out of them, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania are called Baltic States. Finland is grouped among Nordic Countries. The countries in Oceania are 14 viz. Australia, Fiji, Kiribati, Marshall Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Nauru, New Zealand, Palau, Papua New Guinea, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Tonga, Tuvalu, and Vanuatu. Note: Oceania has been consistently in news due to cyclone Pam etc. and airplane crashes.
